CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 21, 1956, pg. 1 reads: "Killer's Weeping Wives - The "wives" of confessed killer David Heath, shown in a deputy sherif's custody, weep as their claimed husband starts towards the jail for a nine-to-eighteen-year sentence for the murder of his North Side landlord. Mrs. Susie Heath (back to camera) consoles the woman who testified in court that she was Mrs. Mabel Bradford Heath, the defendant's common-law wife for five years.  Mrs. Susie Heath said in court that she had been married eighteen years to Heath and never divorced.  Deputy Sheriff Mrs. Alice Barrett is the other woman in picture. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Susie Heath with back to camera, consoling Mabel Bradford Heath, both wives of convicted murderer David Heath, with Deputy Sheriff Alice Barrett on right, standing at doorway in corridor of the Allegheny County Courthouse
